intro: Lotononis ornata, commonly known as the ornate lotonon, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a cluster. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
